intro: Alloschemone occidentalis, commonly known as the western alloschemone, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually narrow and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale green in color. Alloschemone occidentalis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
